page.title: 03INDUSTRY 1
page.content:
{ Industry}in Barrow began with shipping out iron ore that had been mined inland. There were only a few cottages here then. In the 1840's the {railway}came to Furness. Up to then the area had been very remote. Then {iron-making}was started in 1857, and {ship-building}using iron began in 1870.
Today, ship-building is still the most important industry in the town. The shipyard, called Vickers, was nationalised by the Labour Government some years ago. Now there are plans by the Conservative Government to privat- ise it again.
About half the working people in Barrow work for Vickers.
